data.title: Alumni Association
data.text:
Alumni Awards

Every year the College recognizes those alumni, parents and friends that have made a difference in the history of the College.

We invite our alumni to nominate their classmates, friends, or themselves for any of the following awards. If you or someone you know deserves consideration for any of the following, please email the Office of Alumni Engagement at alumni@smcvt.edu to tell us why.

Alumni of the Year

Saint Michael’s awards the Alumni of the Year Awards each year at Reunion to recognize those graduates that have distinguished themselves in years of faithful service to the College to both promote SMC and live the mission.​

Academic Hall of Fame

Founded in May 2002, the Academic Hall of Fame was established to recognize those alumni whose outstanding post-graduate careers further the Mission of the College.

Athletic Hall of Fame

Recognizes those that have excelled both on and off the field during their collegiate careers as athletes, coaches, and administrators. More information

Col. Donald Cook ’56 Award

This award recognizes alumni who unselfishly give of themselves in service to others. The Colonel Donald G. Cook ’56 Award was instituted by former Alumni Association President James. J. Gallagher ’51 and is named after a brave POW who died during the Vietnam War.

Fr. Mike Cronogue Award for Service

This award was created by the Alumni Board of Directors in 2017, following the passing of campus icon Fr. Mike Cronogue, long-time priest of the Society of St. Edmund. Fr. Mike was the founder of the College’s Mobilization of Volunteer Efforts (MOVE) program in 1989. This award recognizes alumni who give their time and energy to better their local community.

Rev. John Verret, SSE Award

In honor and memory of Rev. John Verret SSE, class of 1935, who died during the Battle of the Bulge, this award goes to a graduate of Saint Michael’s College who through their professional accomplishments and/or community contributions and/or service to the nation has supported the mission of both Saint Michael’s College and the Alumni Association. This award was retired in 2018.

Alumni of the Year Awards

Each year during Reunion Weekend, the College awards the Alumni of the Year Awards to recognize alumni that have distinguished themselves in service to the College.

The Alumni Board of Directors votes on nominees who have demonstrated a commitment to the College and who continue to live the mission. Alumni who are celebrating their reunion are considered and are at least 10 years out from their graduation.

Introduced in 2013, the Young Alumnus/a of the Year Award recognizes a graduate five years out who has shown loyalty to his or her alma mater through volunteerism.

If you would like to nominate a graduate for Alumnus/a of the Year recognition please email alumni@smcvt.edu and tell us why.

Fr. Mike Cronogue Award for Service

Established in 2018, this award is named in memory of Rev. Michael P. Cronogue, SSE who was a member of the Saint Michael’s College community for over 35 years. The founder of the Mobilization of Volunteer Efforts Office (M.O.V.E.), Fr. Mike was passionate about service and seeing Saint Michael’s students making a positive difference locally and globally through their actions. This award is given to a Saint Michael’s graduate who through their professional accomplishments and/or community contributions and or service to the nation has supported the mission of Saint Michael’s College and the Alumni Association. This award is not given each year.

2018 – Brian Donahue ’88

2019 – Jim Wall ’74

2020 – not awarded

2021 – Katherine Hackett ’11

2022 – Mary-Joan Picone ’87

2023 – Christopher Lee ’93 (posthumously)

Academic Hall of Fame

The Academic Hall of Fame celebrates Saint Michael’s College alumni whose post-graduate careers further the Mission of the College, “…to the enhancement of the human person and to the advancement of human culture in light of the Catholic faith.”

In particular, it recognizes those graduates who have accomplished scholarship and creative activity of discovery, integration, application or service that emulates the academic, cultural, and civic goals of the College. The inaugural Alumni Academic Hall of Fame award was made during the 2002 Commencement Ceremonies.

To date, the following Saint Michael’s alumni have been inducted into the Alumni Academic Hall of Fame:

Colonel Donald Cook Award

This award recognizes alumni who unselfishly give of themselves in service to others. The Colonel Donald G. Cook ’56 Award was instituted by former Alumni Association President James. J. Gallagher ’51 and is considered the College’s highest honor for alumni.

This award is inspired by the example of Colonel Donald G. Cook ’56 who was posthumously awarded the Medal of Honor during the Vietnam War. As a POW, he “repeatedly assumed more than his share of manual labor in order that the other POWs could improve the state of their health. Colonel Cook willingly and unselfishly put the interest of his comrades before his own well-being and, eventually, his life.” A copy of Colonel Cook’s Medal of Honor was presented to Saint Michael’s College on October 22, 2004 and is displayed in the Pomerleau Alumni Center.

This award is typically bestowed upon recipients during Reunion Weekend and most often when the recipient is celebrating a landmark reunion year. There are no limitations on how soon after graduation an alumnus/a can receive the award.

If you know of an alumnus or alumna who matches the criteria for this award, please email alumni@smcvt.edu and tell us who and why he/she deserves consideration.

Academic Hall of Fame

The Academic Hall of Fame celebrates Saint Michael’s College alumni whose post-graduate careers further the Mission of the College, “…to the enhancement of the human person and to the advancement of human culture in light of the Catholic faith.”

In particular, it recognizes those graduates who have accomplished scholarship and creative activity of discovery, integration, application or service that emulates the academic, cultural, and civic goals of the College. The inaugural Alumni Academic Hall of Fame award was made during the 2002 Commencement Ceremonies.

To date, the following Saint Michael’s alumni have been inducted into the Alumni Academic Hall of Fame:

Colonel Donald Cook Award

This award recognizes alumni who unselfishly give of themselves in service to others. The Colonel Donald G. Cook ’56 Award was instituted by former Alumni Association President James. J. Gallagher ’51 and is considered the College’s highest honor for alumni.

This award is inspired by the example of Colonel Donald G. Cook ’56 who was posthumously awarded the Medal of Honor during the Vietnam War. As a POW, he “repeatedly assumed more than his share of manual labor in order that the other POWs could improve the state of their health. Colonel Cook willingly and unselfishly put the interest of his comrades before his own well-being and, eventually, his life.” A copy of Colonel Cook’s Medal of Honor was presented to Saint Michael’s College on October 22, 2004 and is displayed in the Pomerleau Alumni Center.

This award is typically bestowed upon recipients during Reunion Weekend and most often when the recipient is celebrating a landmark reunion year. There are no limitations on how soon after graduation an alumnus/a can receive the award.

If you know of an alumnus or alumna who matches the criteria for this award, please email alumni@smcvt.edu and tell us who and why he/she deserves consideration.
